channel.title: Legals on Jakarta® EE: The New Home of Cloud Native Java
channel.description: Recent content in Legals on Jakarta® EE: The New Home of Cloud Native Java

item.title: Oracle/JCP Acronym Guidelines
item.author: webdev@eclipse-foundation.org (Christopher Guindon)
item.description: Guidelines for the use of existing Oracle/JCP Acronyms. Supplement to the Eclipse Foundation Guidelines for Eclipse Logos & Trademarks Policy Version 1.0 - June 26, 2019 The goal of these guidelines is to avoid confusion and ensure that the developer community can easily identify whether a Jakarta EE project, specification, test suite, or other related item originates from Oracle/JCP or from the Eclipse/Jakarta EE process. The list of Oracle/JCP acronyms appears at the bottom of this document.

item.title: Jakarta EE Trademark Guidelines
item.author: webdev@eclipse-foundation.org (Christopher Guindon)
item.description: Supplement to the Eclipse Foundation Guidelines for Eclipse Logos & Trademarks Policy for Jakarta EE Marks Version 1.1 - June 13, 2019 This document supplements the Eclipse Foundation Guidelines for Eclipse Logos & Trademarks Policy (this Supplement, together with the Eclipse Foundation Guidelines for Eclipse Logos & Trademarks Policy, collectively, the “Policy”) to address the permitted usage of the Jakarta EE Marks (as defined below). The Jakarta EE marks include, but are not limited to, the following names and/or logos: Jakarta EE, Jakarta EE Working Group, Jakarta EE Member, and Jakarta EE Compatible, (collectively the “Jakarta EE Marks”).
